job_description: Applicants must have current authorization to work in the United States on a full-time basis.Job DescriptionThe Data Analyst is primarily responsible for utilizing tools such as Power BI, Salesforce, Excel, and SQL to perform in-depth analysis on market intelligence data. The analyst will produce market intelligence materials required by the business (i.e. slides, charts, decks, etc.), and use various business intelligence and analytical tools to conduct analyses to support budgeting and forecasting exercises as required. By orchestrating innovative projects, the analyst will optimize existing or develop new processes that drive business objectives and increase operational efficiencies.  The analyst will work closely with the Business Development Relationship Managers to conduct regular input, review, and reconciliation of gathered market intelligence data.About the JobVerify, extract, transform, append, and standardize data from disparate data types and sources to meet system/business requirementsExecute established processes independently, accurately, and timely with the ability to solve for nuances using technical and analytical skillsPerform ad-hoc analysis to preserve data quality, identify critical issues, mitigate risk, and reveal data trends (e.g. profitability, performance, and variance analysis)  Serve as a key member to solve data issues by working closely with internal and external stakeholdersMake recommendations to improve business processesDesign, develop, implement, and maintain technical solutions to increase operational efficiencies and deliver on strategic initiativesSupport data warehousing architecture by gathering requirements, defining user acceptance testing, documenting changes, and monitoring resultsRequiredBachelor; Quantitative field0 - 2 years of experience in an analytical / quantitative role, or equivalent educationPreferredTechnical — Proficient with MS Office; ability to write, analyze, and develop SQL code (Optional: Power Bi, Azure Synapse, R, Python)Experience working with large relational databases is a plusCritical thinking – must be able to derive insights and identify trends from a given data setCommunication – Data analysts collaborate with a variety of audiences. Must be able to effectively communicate using different mediums (oral and written)Agile – Data analysts must understand the requirements and be flexible and dynamic in their approachStarting CompensationAnnual Salary: $82,500.00 - $107,199.00 (Amount based on office location, relevant experience, skills, and competencies)If you are wondering why you should work for us, here is something to help you decide:Pay and Bonuses: Earn a competitive salary.
